title: Remote Desktop Protocl (RDP) Blocking
description: Blocking RDP can prevent data loss and harden against hackers gaining a foothold inside the intranet.
key-ideas: RDP can be exploited by a hacker to gain an internal foothold into the intranet.
RDP can be exploited by an untrained or malicious user to steal or transfer data out of an organization.
RDP can be blocked through user, group, or device policies.
RDP can be blocked through HIPS or EDR applianecs.
RDP can be blocked by firewalls blocking services (port 3389).
